name: Voltic
headline: Electric cargo ships
description: We are working to reduce greenhouse gas emissions in the shipping industry by replacing fuel with solar panels. Solar-powered cargo ships have the potential to eliminate 2.2% of global CO2 production, while simultaneously cutting shipping costs by 50-75% depending on route. We are making a boat that is both greener and cheaper.

founders.name: Prosser Cathey, Founder
founders.description: Prosser is the founder and CEO of Voltic. He is excited to make the shipping industry greener and more efficient. Prosser grew up in Ligonier, PA, where he was the oldest of five siblings. He graduated from MIT in three years with multiple majors, winning a Fulbright upon graduation to study the auto industry's transition to EVs. He also rowed for MIT's D1 Heavyweight Crew team, with whom he won a Gold Medal at Head of the Charles. In his free time, he enjoys pizza, movies and skiing.

# **We Operate Electric Cargo Ships**
At scale, our ships will eliminate
  * ## 2.2%
of global **CO2** production
  * ## 15%
of global **NOx** production
  * ## 13%
of global **SOx** production


![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/66e1c393081ba744690ac718/4f982d67-2722-4a41-98ae-68a7429cc7fa/6271316c154cd896827670.jpg)
## Global Shipping Solutions
We offer coastal and trans-oceanic routes around the globe. Our customers are freight forwarders and beneficial cargo owners. A few of the routes they’ve requested we run for them are Asia-LA, Asia-Europe and Inter-Asia. 
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/66e1c393081ba744690ac718/7788bf33-98d8-48c8-9b63-4860d11ac958/voltic+hero+best.jpg)
## **Uncompromising Reliability**
Voltic’s ships are designed to deliver the same level of reliability as traditional vessels. To ensure maximum safety and reliability, every ship has a traditional diesel system on board as a backup. 
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/66e1c393081ba744690ac718/86182933-a481-464f-a5f7-d3ca2788cd5a/zero+emission.jpeg)
## Zero-Emission Speed
Switching to Voltic’s zero-emission ships does not require compromises on speed. Our sustainable shipping solutions help you reduce carbon footprints while maintaining the same transit time you’re accustomed to. 
Video is not available or format is not supported. Try a different browser.
## EU and IMO regulations passed in 2023 and 2024 are forcing the industry to decarbonize. Voltic is leading the way. 
**In the News**
  * ## Voltic: Electric Cargo Ships
Voltic is building electric cargo ships that are zero-emission and 3x more profitable than existing ships. They designed a solar and battery tech stack that can completely power a container ship at standard operating speeds.
[Read More](https://volticshipping.com/<https:/www.ycombinator.com/launches/J9U-voltic-electric-cargo-ships>)
  * ## 5 Unusual Ways to Decarbonize the Shipping Industry Right Now
The transition to cleaner fuel is just one way to decarbonize the shipping industry. New retrofit technologies are emerging that can significantly reduce shipping emissions with less wait time.
[Read More](https://volticshipping.com/<https:/www.triplepundit.com/story/2024/decarbonize-shipping-industry/794641>)
  * ## American-Made Solar Prize Round 7
The American-Made Solar Prize is a multi-million dollar competition designed to spur innovations in U.S. solar hardware and software technologies and address challenges to rapid, equitable solar energy deployment. This challenge requires competitors to make progress quickly, form private-sector partnerships, and engage customers to bring their ideas to life over the course of three escalating challenges.
[Read More](https://volticshipping.com/<https:/www.energy.gov/eere/solar/american-made-solar-prize-round-7>)


## Supported by

generated_description:
**Voltic: Changing the Face of Shipping with Electric Cargo Ships**

Founded in 2022 and now a proud member of Y Combinator's Batch S22, Voltic is on a mission to revolutionize the shipping industry by developing electric cargo ships powered predominantly by solar energy. The company has its eyes set on a significant goal: to drastically cut greenhouse gas emissions associated with shipping, aiming to eliminate 2.2% of global CO2 emissions, alongside reducing costs by an impressive 50-75%, depending on the route.

### What Makes Voltic Stand Out?

1. **Eco-Friendly Innovation**: Voltic's electric cargo ships are designed to be both environmentally friendly and economically viable. This approach places them at the forefront of the industry’s push towards decarbonization, especially as new EU and IMO regulations come into play in the coming years. Their ships are expected not only to meet but exceed the reliability standards of traditional vessels, featuring backup diesel systems for safety.

2. **High-Impact Solutions**: The numbers speak for themselves. Alongside the reduction of CO2 emissions, Voltic's technology promises to cut down 15% of global NOx and 13% of SOx emissions—making significant strides in combatting air pollution.

3. **Global Reach**: Voltic offers a variety of coastal and trans-oceanic routes, catering to requests from freight forwarders and cargo owners. Key routes include Asia to Los Angeles, Asia to Europe, and various inter-Asia connections. This positions Voltic well to become a preferred choice for shippers around the world.

4. **Speed Without Compromise**: One common misconception about transitioning to greener transportation options is the need to compromise on speed. Voltic debunks this myth, ensuring their zero-emission ships maintain the same transit times that shippers are accustomed to.

### The Team and Support

Operating with a lean team of five based in Cambridge, MA, Voltic is backed by Harj Taggar, their Group Partner from Y Combinator. Their small size suggests agility and close-knit collaboration, essential for innovating rapidly in a competitive space.

### The Bigger Picture

As global shipping continues to grapple with its impact on climate change, Voltic stands as a beacon of hope and a model for what future shipping might look like. Their blend of sustainability and profitability could very well pave the way for broader industry changes, challenging rivals to rethink their operational strategies.

From cutting emissions to providing reliable shipping solutions at competitive prices, Voltic is not just participating in the future of shipping; it's leading the charge towards a more sustainable and efficient industry. 

For more information about their innovative solutions and routes, check out their [website](https://volticshipping.com/).
